Option C: A cartoon scientist in a lab coat holding papers with a bubble saying “...to read and access and build upon...”

The description matches the visual elements shown on the screen during the narration, which depicts a cartoon scientist holding papers with a speech bubble explaining the concept of open access.

The visual that accompanies the explanation is option B: A "FREE TO RE-USE" panel featuring a grid of empty squares and a DNA strand on the right. This image likely represents the concept of open access allowing users to freely reuse research materials, including scientific manuscripts and data. The DNA strand may also emphasize the potential for mining and analyzing large datasets to uncover new insights.
